parametrized_description: A bee farmer transports his honey in small and large bottles, where a small bottle has a capacity of SmallBottleCapacity units of honey and a large bottle has a capacity of LargeBottleCapacity units of honey. The farmer has available at most MaxSmallBottles small bottles and at most MaxLargeBottles large bottles. Additionally, the number of small bottles used must be at least MinRatioSmallToLarge times the number of large bottles used. The total number of bottles transported must not exceed MaxTotalBottles, and at least MinLargeBottles large bottles must be used. The farmer aims to maximize the total amount of honey transported.

SmallBottleCapacity.description: Capacity of a small bottle in units of honey

LargeBottleCapacity.description: Capacity of a large bottle in units of honey

MaxSmallBottles.description: Maximum number of small bottles available

MaxLargeBottles.description: Maximum number of large bottles available

MinRatioSmallToLarge.description: Minimum ratio of small bottles to large bottles

MaxTotalBottles.description: Maximum total number of bottles that can be transported

MinLargeBottles.description: Minimum number of large bottles that must be used

SmallBottlesUsed.description: The number of small bottles used

LargeBottlesUsed.description: The number of large bottles used

constraints.description: The number of small bottles used must be at least MinRatioSmallToLarge times the number of large bottles used.
The total number of bottles transported must not exceed MaxTotalBottles.
At least MinLargeBottles large bottles must be used.
The number of small bottles used must not exceed MaxSmallBottles.
The number of large bottles used must not exceed MaxLargeBottles.

objective.description: Maximize the total amount of honey transported, which is the sum of (SmallBottleCapacity × number of small bottles) and (LargeBottleCapacity × number of large bottles).
